factoid: Pierre was silent.
Prince Andrew was silent.
Pierre did not care to begin talking.
Prince Andrew did not care to begin talking.
Pierre continually glanced at Prince Andrew.
Prince Andrew rubbed his forehead with his small hand.
Prince Andrew said, "Let us go and have supper," with a sigh.
Prince Andrew went to the door.
Pierre and Prince Andrew entered the elegant, newly decorated, and luxurious dining room.
All items in the dining room, including table napkins, silver, china, and glass, bore an imprint of newness found in the households of the newly married.
At halfway through supper, Prince Andrew leaned his elbows on the table.
Prince Andrew had a look of nervous agitation on his face.
Prince Andrew began to talk.
Prince Andrew had long had something on his mind and suddenly decided to speak out.
Prince Andrew said, "Never, never marry, my dear fellow."
Prince Andrew advised that one should never marry until one can say to oneself that one has done all one is capable of.
Prince Andrew advised that one should never marry until one has ceased to love the woman of one's choice and has seen her plainly as she is.
Prince Andrew warned that otherwise one will make a cruel and irrevocable mistake.
Prince Andrew warned that one should marry only when old and good for nothing, or else all that is good and noble will be lost.
Prince Andrew warned that it will all be wasted on trifles.
Prince Andrew said, "Yes! Yes! Yes!"
Prince Andrew told the listener not to look at him with surprise.
Prince Andrew warned that if one marries expecting anything from oneself in the future, one will feel at every step that for one all is ended, all is closed except the drawing room.
Prince Andrew warned that in the drawing room one will be ranged side by side with a court lackey and an idiot.
Prince Andrew asked, "But what's the good?"
Prince Andrew waved his arm.
Pierre took off his spectacles.
Pierre's face seemed different after taking off his spectacles.
Pierre's good-natured expression became more apparent after taking off his spectacles.
Pierre gazed at Prince Andrew in amazement.
Prince Andrew said, "My wife is an excellent woman."
Prince Andrew said, "My wife is one of those rare women with whom a man's honor is safe."
Prince Andrew said, "I would give anything to be unmarried."
Prince Andrew said, "You are the first and only one to whom I mention this because I like you."
Prince Andrew was less than ever like Bolkónski.
Bolkónski lolling in Anna Pávlovna’s easy chairs.
Bolkónski had half-closed eyes.
Bolkónski had uttered French phrases between his teeth.
Prince Andrew's every muscle of his thin face quivered with nervous excitement.
Prince Andrew's eyes, which had seemed extinguished, now flashed with brilliant light.
Prince Andrew seemed more lifeless at ordinary times.
Prince Andrew became more impassioned in moments of almost morbid irritation.
Prince Andrew said, "You don't understand why I say this."
Prince Andrew said, "It is the whole story of life."
Prince Andrew said, "You talk of Bonaparte and his career."
Prince Andrew said, "Bonaparte when he worked went step by step toward his goal."
Prince Andrew said, "Bonaparte was free."
Prince Andrew said, "Bonaparte had nothing but his aim to consider."
Prince Andrew said, "Bonaparte reached his goal."
Prince Andrew said, "If you tie yourself up with a woman, like a chained convict, you lose all freedom."
Prince Andrew said, "All you have of hope and strength merely weighs you down and torments you with regret."
Prince Andrew said, "Drawing rooms, gossip, balls, vanity, and triviality are the enchanted circle I cannot escape from."
Prince Andrew said, "I am now going to the war, the greatest war there ever was."
Prince Andrew said, "I know nothing and am fit for nothing."
Prince Andrew said, "I am very amiable and have a caustic wit."
Prince Andrew said, "At Anna Pávlovna’s they listen to me."
Prince Andrew said, "That stupid set without whom my wife cannot exist."
Prince Andrew said, "Those women."
Prince Andrew said, "If you only knew what those society women are, and women in general."
Prince Andrew said, "My father is right."
Prince Andrew said, "Women are selfish, vain, stupid, trivial in everything."
Prince Andrew said, "When you meet them in society it seems as if there were something in them, but there’s nothing."
Prince Andrew said, "No, don't marry, my dear fellow."
Prince Andrew said, "Don't marry."
Pierre said, "It seems funny to me."
Pierre said, "Prince Andrew should consider himself incapable."
Pierre said, "Prince Andrew's life is a spoiled life."
Pierre said, "Prince Andrew has everything before him."
Pierre said, "Prince Andrew has everything."
